definition.name: Vercel Action
definition.description: This action make a deployment with github actions instead of Vercel builder.

inputs.name: github-comment
inputs.description: if you want to comment on pr and commit, set true, default: true

inputs.name: github-token
inputs.description: if you want to comment on pr and commit, set token

inputs.name: github-deployment
inputs.description: if you want to create github deployment, set true, default: false

inputs.name: vercel-project-id
inputs.description: Vercel CLI 17+, ❗️  The `name` property in vercel.json is deprecated (https://zeit.ink/5F)

inputs.name: vercel-org-id
inputs.description: Vercel CLI 17+, ❗️  The `name` property in vercel.json is deprecated (https://zeit.ink/5F)

inputs.name: vercel-project-name
inputs.description: The name of the project; if absent we'll use the `vercel inspect` command to determine.

inputs.name: scope
inputs.description: If you are work in team scope, you should set this value to your team id.

inputs.name: now-project-id
inputs.description: Vercel CLI 17+, ❗️  The `name` property in vercel.json is deprecated (https://zeit.ink/5F)

inputs.name: now-org-id
inputs.description: Vercel CLI 17+, ❗️  The `name` property in vercel.json is deprecated (https://zeit.ink/5F)

inputs.name: alias-domains
inputs.description: You can assign a domain to this deployment. Please note that this domain must have been configured in the project. You can use pull request number via `{{PR_NUMBER}}` and branch via `{{BRANCH}}`
